description: Number of unitary prime factors of LCM[1,...,n], i.e. primes in LCM with exponent 1.
comments: Number of primes in the interval ]sqrt(n), n], (i.e., excluding sqrt(n) but including n). - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Mar 31 2005
example: n=100, LCM[100] has 25 prime factors of which only 2 and 3 has exponent larger than 1 resulting powers: 64 and 81. So 23 prime-factors are unitary, i.e. with exponent 1. So a(100)=23.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 28 2000
